speaker: Hamlet
text: Soft you now, the fair Ophelia.
Nymph, in thy orisons be all
my sins remembered.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Good my lord, how does your
Honor for this many a day?

speaker: Hamlet
text: I humbly thank you, well.

speaker: Ophelia
text: My lord, I have remembrances
of yours that I have long√®d
long to redeliver.

speaker: Ophelia
text: I pray you now receive them.

speaker: Hamlet
text: No, not I. I never gave you
aught.

speaker: Ophelia
text: My honored lord, you know right
well you did, and with them
words of so sweet breath

speaker: Ophelia
text: composed as made the things
more rich. Their perfume lost,
take these again, for to the

speaker: Ophelia
text: noble mind rich gifts wax poor
when givers prove unkind.
There, my lord.

speaker: Hamlet
text: Ha ha, are you honest?

speaker: Ophelia
text: My lord?

speaker: Hamlet
text: Are you fair?

speaker: Ophelia
text: What means your Lordship?

speaker: Hamlet
text: That if you be honest and fair,
your honesty should admit no
discourse to your beauty.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Could beauty, my lord, have
better commerce than with
honesty?

speaker: Hamlet
text: Ay, truly, for the power of
beauty will sooner transform
honesty from what it is to a

speaker: Hamlet
text: bawd than the force of honesty
can translate beauty into
likeness. This was sometime

speaker: Hamlet
text: a paradox, but now the time
gives it proof.
I did love you once.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Indeed, my lord, you made me
believe so.

speaker: Hamlet
text: You should not have believed
me, for virtue cannot so
inoculate our old stock but we

speaker: Hamlet
text: Shall relish of it.
I love you not.

speaker: Ophelia
text: I was the more deceived.

speaker: Hamlet
text: Get thee to a nunnery. Why
wouldst thou be a breeder of
sinners? I am myself indifferent

speaker: Hamlet
text: honest, but yet I could accuse
me of such things that it were
better my mother had not borne

speaker: Hamlet
text: me. We are arrant knaves all;
believe none of us. Go thy ways
to a nunnery.

speaker: Ophelia
text: O, help him, you sweet heavens!

speaker: Hamlet
text: If thou dost marry, I'll give
thee this plague for thy dowry:
Be thou as chaste as ice, as

speaker: Hamlet
text: pure as snow, thou shalt not
escape calumny. Get thee to a
nunnery, farewell. Or if thou

speaker: Hamlet
text: wilt needs marry, marry a fool,
for wise men know well enough
what monsters you make of them.

speaker: Hamlet
text: To a nunnery, go, and quickly
too. Farewell.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Heavenly powers, restore him!

speaker: Hamlet
text: I have heard of your paintings
too, well enough. God hath
given you one face, and you

speaker: Hamlet
text: make yourselves another. You
jig and amble, and you lisp;
you nickname God's creatures

speaker: Hamlet
text: and make your wantonness your
ignorance. Go to, I'll no more
on't. It hath made me mad.

speaker: Hamlet
text: I say we will have no more
marriage. Those that are
married already, all but one,

speaker: Hamlet
text: shall live. The rest shall keep
as they are. To a nunnery, go.
